alert.note: Alert for Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 10:17PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western Virginia, including the following county: Highland. * WHEN...Until 515 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1015 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monterey... Vanderpool... Mustoe... Mcdowell... Clover Creek... Hightown... Sirons Mill... Possum Trot... Liberty... New Hampden... Mill Gap... Blue Grass... Doe Hill... Head Waters... Williamsville... Bolar... Palo Alto... - Please visit https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety information.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
